subject: Re: [junit] Problem with configuration classes
msgSnippet: ... Hi Jason, this is another possible solution, but I think the factory problem is still there. Even in this case I ll need a ListenerFactory to create a
messageBody:
Jason Rogers wrote:
> Why not create Listeners with one or more Handlers and have the
> Listeners pass the Event to all of their Handlers. The Handlers decide
> whether or not they care about the event; if so, do something about it.
> That way you can mock the Handler implementation, create a Listener with
> it and test that the Listener is doing the right thing. Then you test
> the specific implementations of the Handler, which is where the most
> interesting test is anyway -- 'Does the Handler affect the System
> properly?'.
>

Hi Jason,
this is another possible solution, but I think the factory problem is
still there.
Even in this case I'll need a ListenerFactory to create a Listener set
up with all the handlers I need.
The code in the factory would be a little simpler: do you think as much
not to need to unit test it?


Lorenzo
